00091 void delay_us(int us)
00092 {
00093     volatile int delay;
00094     delay = ((48*us)/16);
00095     while (delay--) {};

00110 u8 spiReadWrite(u8 val)
00111 {
00112     /* Transmission is started by writing the transmit data. */
00113     SPI_TDR_1 = val;
00114 
00115     /* Wait for receiver data register full. */
00116     while((SPI_SR_1 & SPI_RDRF) == 0);
00117 
00118     /* Read data. */
00119     val = SPI_RDR_1;
00120 
00121     return val;
00122 }

00129 volatile u32 debug_spi;
00130 int spiInit(void)
00131 {
00132     // Before anything else, reset the SPI.
00133     SPI_CR_1 = SPI_SWRST;
00134 
00135     // Enable either A or B peripheral of PIOA.
00136     PIO_BSR_A = SPI_RF_PINS;
00137 
00138     // Disable PIO control and Enable manual control for sel pin and peripheral
00139     // control for miso, mosi and sck.
00140     PIO_PDR_A = SPI_RF_PINS;
00141 
00142     // Enable manual control of the sel pin.
00143     PIO_PER_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00144 
00145     // Set SEL line as an output pin.
00146     PIO_OER_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00147 
00148     // Set the line drive to high for CS.
00149     PIO_SODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00150 
00151     // Enable SPI clock.
00152     PMC_PCER = (PMC_PCSR | SPI1);
00153 
00154     // SPI reset - AGAIN! Then enable!
00155     SPI_CR_1 = SPI_SWRST;
00156     SPI_CR_1 = SPIEN;
00157 
00158     // Set SPI to fixed peripheral at SPI0_CS2 or SPI1_CS0, fault detection
00159     // disabled, master mode.
00160     SPI_MR_1 = ((SPI_RF_CS_MR << SPI_PCS_LSB) | MODFDIS | SPI_MSTR);
00161 
00162     // Data is sampled on the falling edge of the SPCK.
00163     // SPI baud is empirically set to 6.5MHz.
00164     SPI_CSR0_1 = ((0x08 << SPI_SCBR_LSB) | SPI_8_BITS | SPI_NCPHA);
00165 
00166     return 0;
00167 }

00172 void hal_init(void)
00173 {
00174     // IO Specific Initialization.
00175 
00176     //Enable SLP_TR as output.
00177     PIO_OER_A = SLPTRPIN;
00178 
00179     // Set the SLP_TR pin low.
00180     PIO_CODR_A = SLPTRPIN;
00181 
00182     //Enable RST as output.
00183     PIO_OER_A = RSTPIN;
00184 
00185     // Set reset high since the radio reset is active low.
00186     PIO_SODR_A = RSTPIN;
00187 
00188     // Set the IRQ0 (PA30) pin to disable the pull up resistor.
00189     //    PIO_RF_PUDR = IRQPIN;
00190 
00191     // Initialize the IRQ.
00192     // IRQ0 (PA30) is an external interrupt and it is not necessary to assign
00193     // the IO to the interrupt function as the PIO Controller has no effect on
00194     // inputs and the interrupt lines (FIQ or IRQ's) are used only as inputs.
00195 
00196     // Set ISR the vector. Cast to int to eliminate compiler warning.
00197     AIC_SVR30 = (u32)radioIsrHandler;
00198 
00199     // Initialize edge triggered with defined priority.
00200     AIC_SMR30 = 0x67;
00201 
00202     // Clear the ISR.
00203     AIC_ICCR = AIC_IRQ0;
00204 
00205     // Enable the IRQ
00206     AIC_IECR = AIC_IRQ0;
00207 
00208     // Set up for SPI manual only mode.
00209     spiInit();
00210 }

00224 u8 hal_register_read(u8 address)
00225 {
00226     u8 dummy = 0;
00227 
00228     //Add the register read command to the register address.
00229     address &= HAL_TRX_CMD_RADDRM;
00230     address |= HAL_TRX_CMD_RR;
00231 
00232     // Send the address to read.
00233     fnInUserInterrupt(1); // entering;
00234     uDisable_Interrupt() ;
00235 
00236     // Pull SEL line.
00237     //PIO_CODR_A = _BV(SPI_RF_NPCS);
00238     PIO_CODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00239 
00240     // Transmission is started by writing the transmit data.
00241     SPI_TDR_1 = address;
00242 
00243     // Wait for receiver data register full.
00244     while((SPI_SR_1 & SPI_RDRF) == 0);
00245 
00246     // Dummy read.
00247     dummy = SPI_RDR_1;
00248 
00249     // Read the data by sending a dummy byte.
00250 
00251     // Transmission is started by writing the transmit data.
00252     SPI_TDR_1 = HAL_DUMMY_READ;
00253 
00254     // Wait for receiver data register full.
00255     while((SPI_SR_1 & SPI_RDRF) == 0);
00256 
00257     // Release SEL line.
00258     PIO_SODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00259 
00260     // Read data.
00261     address = SPI_RDR_1;
00262 
00263     uEnable_Interrupt();
00264     fnInUserInterrupt(0); // leaving
00265 
00266     return address;
00267 }

00278 void hal_register_write(u8 address, u8 value)
00279 {
00280     // Add the Register Write command to the address.
00281     address = HAL_TRX_CMD_RW | (HAL_TRX_CMD_RADDRM & address);
00282 
00283     // Send the address to write.
00284     fnInUserInterrupt(1); // entering;
00285     uDisable_Interrupt() ;
00286 
00287     // Pull SEL line.
00288     PIO_CODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00289 
00290     // Transmission is started by writing the transmit data.
00291     SPI_TDR_1 = address;
00292 
00293     // Wait for receiver data register full.
00294     while((SPI_SR_1 & SPI_RDRF) == 0);
00295 
00296     // Dummy read.
00297     SPI_RDR_1;
00298 
00299     // Write the data to the address.
00300 
00301     // Transmission is started by writing the transmit data.
00302     SPI_TDR_1 = value;
00303 
00304     // Wait for receiver data register full.
00305     while((SPI_SR_1 & SPI_RDRF) == 0);
00306 
00307     // Release SEL line.
00308     PIO_SODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00309 
00310     // Dummy read.
00311     SPI_RDR_1;
00312 
00313     uEnable_Interrupt();
00314     fnInUserInterrupt(0); // leaving
00315 
00316     if ((address & ~HAL_TRX_CMD_RW) == RG_TRX_STATE)
00317     {
00318         // set rx_mode flag based on mode we're changing to
00319         value &= 0x1f;   // Mask for TRX_STATE register
00320         if (value == RX_ON ||
00321             value == RX_AACK_ON)
00322             rx_mode = 1;
00323         else
00324             rx_mode = 0;
00325     }
00326     // Return data not necessary...
00327 }

00341 u8 hal_subregister_read(u8 address, u8 mask, u8 position)
00342 {
00343     //Read current register value and mask out subregister.
00344     u8 register_value = hal_register_read(address);
00345     register_value &= mask;
00346     register_value >>= position; //Align subregister value.
00347 
00348     return register_value;
00349 }

00363 void hal_subregister_write(u8 address, u8 mask, u8 position,
00364                             u8 value)
00365 {
00366     //Read current register value and mask area outside the subregister.
00367     u8 register_value = hal_register_read(address);
00368     register_value &= ~mask;
00369 
00370     //Start preparing the new subregister value. shift in place and mask.
00371     value <<= position;
00372     value &= mask;
00373 
00374     value |= register_value; //Set the new subregister value.
00375 
00376     //Write the modified register value.
00377     hal_register_write(address, value);
00378 }

00388 void hal_frame_read(void)
00389 {
00390     u8 len;
00391     u8 frame_length;
00392     u8 tempData;
00393     u8 *rx_data=mac_buffer_rx;
00394     rx_frame_t *rx_frame=(rx_frame_t*)mac_buffer_rx;
00395 
00396     fnInUserInterrupt(1); // entering;
00397     uDisable_Interrupt();
00398 
00399     // Pull SEL line.
00400     PIO_CODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00401 
00402     // Send frame read command.
00403     tempData = spiReadWrite(HAL_TRX_CMD_FR);
00404 
00405     // Read frame length.
00406     frame_length = spiReadWrite(HAL_DUMMY_READ);
00407 
00408     len = frame_length;
00409 
00410     // Check for correct frame length.
00411     if ((frame_length >= HAL_MIN_FRAME_LENGTH) && (frame_length <= HAL_MAX_FRAME_LENGTH))
00412     {
00413         *rx_data++ = frame_length; //Store frame length.
00414         do
00415         {
00416             tempData = spiReadWrite(HAL_DUMMY_READ); // dummy write
00417             *rx_data++ = tempData;
00418 
00419         } while (--frame_length > 0);
00420 
00421         // Read LQI value for this frame.
00422         rx_frame->lqi = spiReadWrite(HAL_DUMMY_READ);
00423 
00424         // Release SEL line.
00425         PIO_SODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00426     }
00427     else
00428     {
00429         // Release SEL line.
00430         PIO_SODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00431 
00432         if (rx_frame)
00433         {
00434             rx_frame->length = 0;
00435             rx_frame->lqi    = 0;
00436             rx_frame->crc    = 0;
00437         }
00438     }
00439 
00440     // A dummy read to ensure SPI1 RDRF flag is reset.
00441     SPI_RDR_1;
00442 
00443     uEnable_Interrupt();
00444     fnInUserInterrupt(0); // leaving
00445 }

00454 void hal_frame_write(u8 *write_buffer, u8 length)
00455 {
00456     length &= HAL_TRX_CMD_RADDRM; //Truncate length to maximum frame length.
00457 
00458     fnInUserInterrupt(1); // entering;
00459     uDisable_Interrupt() ;
00460 
00461     //Toggle the SLP_TR pin to initiate the frame transmission.
00462     hal_set_slptr_high();
00463     hal_set_slptr_low();
00464 
00465     // Pull SEL line.
00466     PIO_CODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00467 
00468     // SEND FRAME WRITE COMMAND AND FRAME LENGTH.
00469     spiReadWrite(HAL_TRX_CMD_FW);
00470     spiReadWrite(length);
00471 
00472     //Download to the Frame Buffer.
00473     do
00474     {
00475         spiReadWrite(*write_buffer++);
00476         --length;
00477 
00478     } while (length > 0);
00479 
00480      // Release SEL line.
00481      PIO_SODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00482 
00483     // Dummy read.
00484     SPI_RDR_1;
00485 
00486     uEnable_Interrupt();
00487     fnInUserInterrupt(0); // leaving
00488 }

00504 u8 frame_length;
00505 u8 interrupt_source;
00506 static void radioIsrHandler(void)
00507 {
00508     frame_length = 0;
00509     interrupt_source=0;
00510 
00511     interrupt_source = hal_register_read(RG_IRQ_STATUS);
00512 
00513     if (interrupt_source & HAL_TRX_END_MASK)
00514     {
00515         // Process the event.
00516         radioTrxEndEvent();
00517     }
00518 
00519     // Energy detect event
00520     if (interrupt_source & HAL_ED_READY_MASK)
00521         macEdCallback();
00522 
00523     // Handle the incomming interrupt. Prioritized.
00524     if ((interrupt_source & HAL_RX_START_MASK))
00525     {
00526         // Read Frame length and call rx_start callback.
00527         // Pull SEL line.
00528         PIO_CODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00529 
00530         // Send frame read command.
00531         spiReadWrite(HAL_TRX_CMD_FR);
00532 
00533         // Read frame length.
00534         frame_length = spiReadWrite(HAL_DUMMY_READ);
00535 
00536         // Release SEL line.
00537         PIO_SODR_A = SPI_CS0_1B;
00538 
00539         radioRxStartEvent(frame_length);
00540     }
00541     else if (interrupt_source & HAL_TRX_UR_MASK)
00542         ;
00543     else if (interrupt_source & HAL_PLL_UNLOCK_MASK)
00544         ;
00545     else if (interrupt_source & HAL_PLL_LOCK_MASK)
00546         ;
00547     else if (interrupt_source & HAL_BAT_LOW_MASK)
00548     {
00549         //Disable BAT_LOW interrupt to prevent interrupt storm. The interrupt
00550         //will continously be signaled when the supply voltage is less than the
00551         //user defined voltage threshold.
00552         u8 trx_isr_mask = hal_register_read(RG_IRQ_MASK);
00553         trx_isr_mask &= ~HAL_BAT_LOW_MASK;
00554         hal_register_write(RG_IRQ_MASK, trx_isr_mask);
00555     }
00556     else
00557         ; // unknown ISR
00558 }
